text: The Foundational Model of Anatomy (FMA) is a reference system for human anatomy. It shows the structure of a living organism in a symbolic way. The Structural Informatics Group at the University of Washington created and maintains the FMA. It includes around 75,000 categories and more than 120,000 terms, with over 2.1 million connections between body parts, using 168 types of relationships. == References == Category:Bioinformatics Category:Anatomical terminology Category:Anatomy
title: Foundational Model of Anatomy
